text: September unemployment rates ranged from 3.5% in NE to 15.1% in HI.
Compared with a year prior, Q2 2020 GDP declines ranged from 4.6% in UT to 13.9% in HI.
Leisure and hospitality jobs in DC fell 42% from January to September.
NM’s unemployment rate is down from its July peak but still above its Great Recession levels.
CO and WY saw a yearly increase in manufacturing employment in September.
SC’s Q2 2020 GDP from accommodation and food services was half of what it was in Q2 2019.
NV’s state and local public education jobs fell 17% from September 2019 to September 2020.
All 50 states and DC saw a year-over-year increase in house prices from Q2 2019 to Q2 2020.
Average private-sector weekly earnings ranged from $770 (MS) to $1,804 (DC) in September.
New York’s real GDP from manufacturing dropped to a 15-year low in Q2 2020.
Washington’s annual house price growth has exceeded the US average each quarter since 2014.
